str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To withdraw from, take leave of, renounce, send away.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To bend or turn back; I return. From ana and kampto; to turn back.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Ephesus, a coast city, capital of the Roman province Asia. Probably of foreign origin; Ephesus, a city of Asia Minor.
